Label: Cluster Spacecraft 4, EDI Prime Parameters - G. Paschmann (MPE)

DatasetLink.Title: Cluster Science Archive
DatasetLink.Text: High resolution Cluster data from the

VariableDescription.Name: Status__C4_PP_EDI
VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         STSP Cluster>Solar Terrestrial Science Programme, Cluster
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     VALIDITY                        Validated - minor caveats
#     VALIDATOR                       G. Paschmann (PI)> MPE Garching > gep@mpe.mpg.de
#     CAVEATS                         See also `TEXT' global attr. for Caveats file location
#                                     First production run test - User beware!
#                                     The drift step AND the electric field are reported in SCS, not GSE!  This is                           
#                                      only temporary.                                                                                       
#                                     No filtering using error analysis implemented yet.
#                                     No filtering WRT large magnetic field variance implemented yet
#                                     1) Contrary to the variable names, the drift velocities and the electric
#                                     field vectors are the the SCS (Spacecraft Coordinate System), not GSE!  This
#                                     is temporary.
#                                     2) EDI's automated spin-average algorithm has a known susceptibility
#                                     to producing occassional incorrect, large values of electric fields (and
#                                     drift velocities) under certain conditions.  These bad values are usually
#                                     obvious in plots of the spin-averaged data as single-spin, large spikes.
#                                     Future revisions of the software will remove these bad values.
#                                     3) The time resolution of EDI data varies between spacecraft, and with time,
#                                     due to the success of the electron-beam "tracking" algorithm.  At the time
#                                     of these data the tracking algorithm, and its use of onboard IEL data,
#                                     were still being optimized.
#     STATUS_KEY                      Status[0]= 0 = Bad data
#                                     Status[0]= 1 = Use with caution
#                                     Status[0]= 2 = OK
#                                     Status[0]= 255 = Not Supplied
#     SOURCE_NAME                     C4>Cluster spacecraft 4
#     DATA_TYPE                       PP>Prime Parameter
#     DESCRIPTOR                      EDI>Electron Drift Instrument
#     DATA_VERSION                    01
#     TITLE                           Electron Drift Velocity and Electric Field>Spin averages
#     TEXT                            G. Paschmann et al, The Electron Drift Instrument for Cluster
#                                     Space Sci. Rev., 79,  pp 233 - 269, 1997)
#     MODS                            Produced in accordance with CSDS file specification
#                                     Reference Document for CSDS CDF File Design, DS-QMW-TN-0003
#                                     Data and calibration may be unreliable
#     ADID_REF                        ECLUEDI4
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 C4_PP_EDI_00000000_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  C4_PP_EDI
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Cluster Spacecraft 4, EDI Prime Parameters
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Cluster
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#     PI_NAME                         G. Paschmann
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  MPE
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Refer to CSDS for rules of acknowledgement
#     GENERATED_BY                    Generated by German Cluster Data Centre, Garching
#     GENERATION_DATE                 2001-01-08T14:30:27.000Z
#     INST_MODE                       C4>EDI>0>2000-12-09T00:00:00Z>EDI_NoData>No data detected by QMW cdf writing sw
#     PARENTS                         RDM>20001209
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Refer to CSDS for rules of use
#     SKELETON_VERSION                CSDS_CDF_V2.00
#     INST_SETTINGS                   pp_sc_base>3.2000000
#                                     pp_nbeam_min>4
#                                     pp_acfir>0.0174533
#                                     pp_actof_con>8.0000000
#                                     pp_tri_ang_thresh_1>0.0733038
#                                     pp_tri_ang_thresh_2>0.0366519
#                                     pp_tri_ang_thresh_3>0.113446
#                                     pp_tof_tdiff_thresh>1.41421
#                                     pp_maxorder>5
#                                     pp_qual_min>3
#                                     pp_phase0>5.1696652
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Electric Fields (space)
#     SOFTWARE_VERSION                QMW CDF-writing software, QIFF,  V1.28 [ 04/27/00 ]
#                                     CDF version 2.6.6
#                                     EDI_PISO v0.10
#     VALIDATE                        Compatible with the ISTP CDF Standards
#     SC_ENG_ID                       FM8>?
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Cluster
#     LINK_TEXT                       High resolution Cluster data from the
#     LINK_TITLE                      Cluster Science Archive
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://www.cosmos.esa.int/web/csa
#     SPASE_DATASETRESOURCEID         spase://VMO/NumericalData/Cluster-Tango/EDI/PrimeParameter/4S
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:47:45 2015

VariableDescription.Name: V_ed_xyz_gse__C4_PP_EDI
VariableDescription.LongDescription: EDI drift velocity, GSE frame cartesians
VariableDescription.Header:
# *******************************************************

#                                     The drift step AND the electric field are reported in SCS, not GSE!  This is                           
#                                      only temporary.                                                                                       
#                                     No filtering using error analysis implemented yet.
#                                     No filtering WRT large magnetic field variance implemented yet
#                                     1) Contrary to the variable names, the drift velocities and the electric
#                                     field vectors are the the SCS (Spacecraft Coordinate System), not GSE!  This
#                                     is temporary.
#                                     2) EDI's automated spin-average algorithm has a known susceptibility
#                                     to producing occassional incorrect, large values of electric fields (and
#                                     drift velocities) under certain conditions.  These bad values are usually
#                                     obvious in plots of the spin-averaged data as single-spin, large spikes.
#                                     Future revisions of the software will remove these bad values.
#                                     3) The time resolution of EDI data varies between spacecraft, and with time,
#                                     due to the success of the electron-beam "tracking" algorithm.  At the time
#                                     of these data the tracking algorithm, and its use of onboard IEL data,
#                                     were still being optimized.
#     STATUS_KEY                      Status[0]= 0 = Bad data
#                                     Status[0]= 1 = Use with caution

#                                     Status[0]= 255 = Not Supplied
#     SOURCE_NAME                     C4>Cluster spacecraft 4

#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 Refer to CSDS for rules of acknowledgement

#     INST_MODE                       C4>EDI>0>2000-12-09T00:00:00Z>EDI_NoData>No data detected by QMW cdf writing sw
#     PARENTS                         RDM>20001209
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Refer to CSDS for rules of use
#     SKELETON_VERSION                CSDS_CDF_V2.00
#     INST_SETTINGS                   pp_sc_base>3.2000000
#                                     pp_nbeam_min>4
#                                     pp_acfir>0.0174533
#                                     pp_actof_con>8.0000000
#                                     pp_tri_ang_thresh_1>0.0733038
#                                     pp_tri_ang_thresh_2>0.0366519
